name: atremble
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
shaking slightly in a way that you cannot control, for example because you are frightened, angry, or excited, or because of illness: The puppy was all atremble until the vet gave her a treat to calm her down.
worried or frightened: The rumour of a corporate merger had everyone atremble until the CEO assured us that no jobs would be eliminated.
More examplesFewer examplesThe crowd was atremble with anticipation before the curtain was lifted. The little girl ran inside, chin atremble, after she fell over in the garden.The whole office was atremble over what the future might hold.
